what: Generate survival data with a constant baseline hazard
title: Survival data with a constant baseline hazard
text: simulate 100 participants, entering age 50 administratively censored age 70. baseline hazard constant 0.005, two covariates log-hazard ratio 0.5.
code: set.seed(0) n <- 100 entry_age <- 50 censor_age <- 70 beta <- c(0.5, 0.5) p <- length(beta) covariates <- matrix(rnorm(n * p), ncol = p)  sim <- HDccAnalysis::sim_cox_age_data(   n = n,   entry_age = entry_age,   censor_age = censor_age,   beta = beta,   covariates = covariates,   baseline_hazard = 0.005 )  head(sim) # # A tibble: 6 × 6 #      id entry_age censor_age event   Exp1    Exp2 #   <int>     <dbl>      <dbl> <int>  <dbl>   <dbl> # 1     1        50         70     0  1.26   0.782  # 2     2        50         70     0 -0.326 -0.777  # 3     3        50         70     0  1.33  -0.616  # 4     4        50         70     0  1.27   0.0466 # 5     5        50         70     0  0.415 -1.13   # 6     6        50         70     0 -1.54   0.577

previous_headings: Generate survival data with a constant baseline hazard
title: Survival data with a constant baseline hazard
code: fit <- survival::coxph(survival::Surv(entry_age, censor_age,event) ~ Exp1 + Exp2, data = sim) print(fit) # survival::coxph(formula = survival::Surv(entry_age, censor_age,  #     event) ~ Exp1 + Exp2, data = sim)  #        coef exp(coef) se(coef)     z       p # Exp1 0.5133    1.6708   0.2475 2.074 0.03806 # Exp2 0.6465    1.9088   0.2323 2.783 0.00539  # Likelihood ratio test=13.06  on 2 df, p=0.001456 # n= 100, number of events= 20

Validate or construct an attained-age baseline hazard table — .make_age_rate_tbl

title: Validate or construct an attained-age baseline hazard table — .make_age_rate_tbl
text: data.frame columns age_lo, age_hi, rate, sorted age_lo.

text: constant baseline hazard given, one-row table covering (-Inf, Inf) constructed. table supplied, validated, coerced numeric, ordered age_lo, returned. NULL, tbl returned unchanged. exp_eta Numeric vector length length(entry_age) giving subject-specific hazard multipliers \(\exp(x\beta)\) used computing expected events expected time risk.

title: Scale baseline hazard to a target average incidence rate — .scale_to_avg_inc
text: function finds single scaling factor \(s\) applied baseline rates \(\lambda_k\) $$   \frac{\mathbb{E}[N(s)]}{\mathbb{E}[T(s)]} = \texttt{avg\_inc\_rate}, $$ \(\mathbb{E}[N(s)] = \sum_i \{1 - \exp(-H_i(s))\}\) expected number events \(\mathbb{E}[T(s)]\) expected time risk, implied scaled hazards subject's follow-window [entry_age, censor_age) attained-age bands [age_lo_k, age_hi_k). baseline rates multiplied factor, relative hazards unchanged; marginal event rate altered. target average incidence rate defined cohort model implied tbl exp_eta. Scaling performed solving multiplicative factor using uniroot. avg_inc_rate non-NULL positive finite number, function errors. bracketing interval root found, function errors.

title: Scale baseline hazard to a target average incidence rate — .scale_to_avg_inc
code: tbl <- data.frame(   age_lo = c(50, 60),   age_hi = c(60, 70),   rate   = c(0.01, 0.02) )  entry_age  <- c(52, 55, 61) censor_age <- c(65, 63, 69) exp_eta    <- rep(1, length(entry_age))  .scale_to_avg_inc(tbl, entry_age, censor_age, avg_inc_rate = 0.015, exp_eta) #> Error in .scale_to_avg_inc(tbl, entry_age, censor_age, avg_inc_rate = 0.015,     exp_eta): could not find function ".scale_to_avg_inc"

title: Simulate a single subject's event time under piecewise-constant hazard — .simulate_one
text: simulation proceeds band--band. current attained age current_age, baseline hazard \(h_0()\) obtained age band containing age. waiting time drawn exponential distribution rate h_0() * exp_eta. waiting time occurs end current age band (censor_age), event occurs. Otherwise subject advances next band boundary procedure repeats censor_age. Age bands treated left-closed, right-open intervals: [age_lo, age_hi). attained age equal age_hi assigned next band. baseline hazard must defined attained ages reachable [entry_age, censor_age). age band contains current attained age, function errors. method exact piecewise-constant hazards within age band hazard constant waiting time distribution exponential.
